title: BP's Sunflower: Greenwashing by Design
description: One-minute skill: BP's Sunflower: Greenwashing by Design.

hook.text: In 2000, BP spent $211 million replacing its shield with a green sunflower. Critics called it greenwashing.

buildup.text: BP rebranded as 'Beyond Petroleum,' signaling a shift to renewable energy.

discovery.text: The Helios logo â€” a green and yellow starburst â€” was designed to evoke nature and clean energy.

twist.text: Ten years later, the Deepwater Horizon disaster spilled 4.9 million barrels of oil. The sunflower felt like a lie.

climax.text: BP's rebrand became the textbook example of how a logo can't outrun a company's actions.

punchline.text: A logo promises. Only actions deliver.

quiz.question: Why is BP's 2000 rebrand often cited in design?
options: As a cautionary tale of greenwashing
